data.title: Crash on Ubuntu when exiting from editor
data.body:
I open a mission as usual, open the editor with F11, then select 'File -> Exit Level'. I get a fatal assert here:

```
/media/daniel/DATA/code/Torque/linux/Engine/source/platformSDL/menus/menuBarSDL.cpp(115,0): {Fatal} - 
% Exiting
```

Ubuntu 14.04 x64, compiled with gcc/make.

data.title: tsForestItemData: default to no bounds instead of crazy bounds

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
See #1287.

> As for the source of the crash, the problem originates in [tsForestItemData.h](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/b30b5d907623a89ddb812992de1b0c588f0f41cf/Engine/source/forest/ts/tsForestItemData.h#L91). When the shape file is not found, every item gets given an invalid object box. Then, when the forest cell goes to [update its bounds](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/b30b5d907623a89ddb812992de1b0c588f0f41cf/Engine/source/forest/forestCell.cpp#L180), it tries to update with all these invalid boxes.
> 
> If you're missing a shape file, you really don't want a crash, you want a console error, which you do currently get.

data.title: Apply vignette settings properly for #1302

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
@Duion see if this fixes #1302 for you. Seems to work fine for me!

Annoyingly, there's no cleanup before running a level-specific `postfxpreset.cs` file, so each of these files have to have settings for _all_ postFX in them, hence the change in the Outpost presets (to turn the vignette off). See #1304.

data.title: Reset PostFX settings between every mission
data.body:
Currently, if you enter a mission with some custom PostFX preset (`P1`), which includes settings for some PostFX `FX1`, then you exit that mission and load another mission with its own custom presets (`P2`), which don't include any settings for `FX`, then you get all of `P1`'s settings in this mission, instead of the defaults.

I propose that the templates should exec `core/scripts/client/postFx/default.postfxpresets.cs` before _every_ mission load, _then_ a custom presets file if one is available, to ensure consistent behaviour when new effects are added to the engine, but not to everyone's mission preset files.

Might also be worth thinking about having a separate defaults file, or allowing you to save the current settings to the defaults for your game.

data.title: Vignette PostFX does not save

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
The Vignette PostFX does not save it's values to the postfx.preset file or anywhere else, only on or off gets saved, the strength slider will get reset on game reload.
At the same time the setting for vignette will get carried over to other levels when you open them, even if you did not enable vignette for them.

https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/commit/0e346fed9ffd509b205ab9cba73e0fb34ca902ad

As far as I can see it uses a variable, but it does not get saved anywhere as a preference or so and it does not have variables that get saved in the postfx presets except the on/off button.
No idea how it is supposed to work, but to me it looks like it should be possible to define the vignette values into postfx presets for each mission.

data.body: It appears that passing raw expressions as arguments (e.g. `setExtent(..exp.., 4)`) was causing the `extOrX` value to be the same as `y`, which was unhelpful and bizarre. This fixes it, but I'm not sure how. Fixes #1292.

data.title: Ability to trigger script calls from animations
data.body: As per [this resource](http://www.garagegames.com/community/resources/view/21460). I thought we'd had proposals or PRs for this before, but I can't find them with a search.

data.title: Add static String::isEmpty(const char*) method
data.body:
Add static String::isEmpty(const char*) method and use it to verify path for Forest::saveDataFile() is not empty.  Personally not a fan of the old, free-floating dStrBlahBlah functions - I think they would be easier accessed (and remembered) as String::BlahBlah() static methods, especially since intellisense will help you out this way.

This is preferable to creating a String from the const char\* and then asking the new string if it's empty.

Consider it an "improvement" on https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/1295

data.title: Oculus VR DK2 Support
data.body:
- Updated to work with 0.5.x SDK
- Uses Oculus Rendering rather than PostFX
- Stereo rendering refactored so more rendering info is grabbed from the DisplayDevice
- Implements an Offscreen Canvas for in-game gui with oculus
- Message dialogs and metrics display can now go to the OffScreen Canvas (if oculus demo is setup correctly)

Resolves issue #1296

data.title: Oculus VR DK2 Support
data.body:
The Engine needs support for the latest DK2 and 5.x SDK. Posting an issue here so it can be better tracked.

Also an update to the wiki documentation would be useful as currently it is awful.

data.title: Add check for empty string before overwriting the object data file name
data.body:
The EngineAPI method passes in "" by default - which is not null, so passes the if(path) condition and overwrites the object's mDataFileName with an empty string.  This in turn asserts when it tries to save the file.

So, adding a check for an empty string seems the "cheapest" fix.

data.title: Torque3D 3.7-RC - libogg fails to compile on Linux (OpenSUSE 13.2)
data.body:
System: OpenSUSE 13.2 (64-bit)
Build system: cmake, make (GCC 4.8)

I've got this error:

```
../Torque3D-3.7-rc/Engine/lib/libogg/include/ogg/os_types.h:143:32: fatal error: ogg/config_types.h: No such file or directory
```

It can be fixed by:
1. Download ogg library source from `http://www.xiph.org/downloads/`.
2. Compile it on your machine to create `config_types.h` from `config_types.h.in` file.
3. Copy `config_types.h` to `../Torque3D-3.7-rc/Engine/lib/libogg/include/ogg/`.
4. Compile Torque3D again.

data.title: Feature Request:  ShapeBase:setEyeVector() in TScript
data.body:
to accompany the function
Shapebase:getEyeVector() found here 
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/1c580f5a5f2fc93a7432316275ae394d71dfc519/Engine/source/T3D/shapeBase.cpp#L4120

command:
%ShapeBaseObj.setEyeVector( vectorF );

usage:
rotates the eye node of the object.

returns:
return 1 if an attached "eye" node was rotated.
return 0 if there is no eye node.

Purpose:
allows a TScript method for rotating camera views on objects that have an eye node attached.
this will allow a TScript access point for such things as changing views in vehicles, changing rayCast targets when not using a muzzlePoint or other refrence point, etc...

data.title: Patch to fix no-sound in Linux

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
The default multi-threaded build under Linux had no sound, and this patch fixes that. There was a problem with the way that worker threads are awakened, and the background loading of sounds was not happening.

Addresses [Issue #1265](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1265)

Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
Level loads, but no forest trees exist. Relevant extract from `console.log`:

```
Executing levels/Outpost.mis.
Failed to create resource: [levels/outpost.forest]
levels/Outpost.mis (0): Register object failed for object theForest of class Forest.
```

Putting this here to remind myself to look into it, and see if anyone else has the issue.

data.title: crash out on net stream leaks.
data.body:
causes a fatal assertion when bitstream is passed an int value it cannot transmit given the provided bit length, and reports what the value and count were, respectively.

example of the revised output:

......\Engine\source\core\stream\bitStream.cpp(339,0): {Fatal} - BitStream::writeInt: value out of range: 40/32 (5 bits)
'Spire_DEBUG.exe' (Win32): Unloaded 'C:\Windows\SysWOW64\D3DCompiler_43.dll'
Error, a DecalManager (547a930) isn't properly out of the bins!
Error, a PhysicalZone (b70f240) isn't properly out of the bins!
Error, a EnvVolume (b712780) isn't properly out of the bins!
Error, a TSStatic (b7203c8) isn't properly out of the bins!

data.title: Projectile Spread calc results in a box
Terrain Editor bug
data.body:
Hi, 
Don't remember seeing this bug in 3.6.3, sorry right now I can't tested.

But in 3.7rc if you use the terrain editor with any tool (raise, grab, smooth, etc) almost always modify two places at the same time.

I not sure if already reported, do some filter but don't see anything.

As you see, the border on the left was modelling while I modelling in the middile.

![terrainbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057449/7335716/0fe6d5ee-eb96-11e4-98ba-1a599cf6436d.JPG)

other bug on the terrain editor, if you do something an undo and then redo the engine crash.

the console don't show nothing.
